text:
Raskolnikov stared at the timid girl. 

“I did not expect you,” he said. 

Sonia flinched, ready to retreat. 

“Please sit down,” he urged, motioning to a chair. 

She hesitated, trembling. 

“I… I have come for one minute,” she stammered. 

“Forgive me for disturbing you,” she added, glancing at the ladies. 

“I come from Katerina Ivanovna,” she continued. 

“She had no one to send. She told me to beg you…” 

Raskolnikov nodded, “I will try, certainly.” 

He stood, faltering, feeling the weight of her fear.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov feels a sudden pang of sympathy for Sonia, who appears humiliated and terrified as she seeks his presence on behalf of Katerina Ivanovna.
